REMEMBER! SOONER OR LATER YOU WILL FLY-THE MODERN METHOD OF TRAVEL
COMMUTERS' SERVICE—Many men of affairs now
make their daily trip to their waterside country homes,
or to their golf courses, in the luxurious cabin of an Aero-
marine Flying Boat. It is speedy and comfortable. What
used to be an hour of grime and land turmoil, coupled
with traffic holdups and other vexatious delays, is now
twenty feeting minutes of safe, restful pastime.
For many business men who spend their summers along
Long Island Sound or the New England or New Jersey
coast resorts, or along the shores of the Hudson, we have
established a
commuters' service at reasonable cost.
From points as distant as 100 or 150 miles from New
York City we can carry business men to their offices in
the morning, and to their homes at night in one-fourth
the time heretofore required.
Our eleven-passen-
ger enclosed Cabin
Aeromarine Flying
Cruiser is the pride ol
the aviation worla to-
day. No conveyance
of sea. and or air is
more exquisitely fur-
nished than this King

hogany
comfortable rechning
chairs trimmed with
silk and leather aid in
giving a sense or quiet
luxury within this
white
and gold air
vacht. I he seating ar-

plane enable you at
all tmes to have a clear vew ot the earth beneath
you with its tiny cities, villages and hamlets, populated
by what appears to be a Lilliputian people.
SAFETY The Aeromarine Airways Fleet is manned
by ocers and crew with a record of long and faithful
service in aerial transit.
After thorough tests by the
U. S. Government they have been passed by authorities
as ten or proven worth and ability to fy seaplanes for
passenger carlyg.
Nothing more serious can happen to an Aeromarine
in flight than an enforced descent—-and herein is one of
the great advantages of travel in FLYING BOATS
-always have the necessary alighting space.
You Ay ONLY over the broad free spaces of the water's
surface.
This gives you the knowledge of 10o per cent
safety when you take your flight.
WHAT TO WEAR One needs no special clothing,
no goggles, or bundlesome paraphernalia, when going on
an all vovage in
an Aeromarine.
Even Milady in her
dainty evening clothes may, without trepidation, step
into the luxurious enclosed cabin and make the journey
from home to hotel, or from seaside resort or yacht to
Atlantic City or Newport, with as much ease and with
much less danger or mental annoyance than in traveling
the length of Fifth Avenue in her limousine
SURE IT'S AN
AROMARINE"
SANTA MARIA 2 0
ONE OF THE WHITE AERIAL FLEET CARRYING MAILS AND PASSENGERS DAILY BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND CUBA
The types of boats used by the Aeromarine Airways have been flown by the U.S. Navy hundreds of thousands of miles.
Due to the carefully designed character of their hulls, their seaworthiness is proverbial. Thousands of passengers have been
aloft in this type of boat and there has never been an accident. They have
been fown for miles off the coast, have landed in all kinds of weather, been
busily engaged in daily flights up and down the English Channel, along the

Atlantic Coast, in

tic, and over the

everywhere ther

COST OF FLYING-The cost for trips is far less
than is charged for air travel in any other part of the
United States. The Passenger Department is ready at
any time to quote rates for sightseeing or to any special
points along the waterwavs or the casc Tor singie pas
sengers or parties. Open and enclosed Flying Boats may
be chartered for exclusive parties for short flights or for
all-day use, or for a week or longer on favorable terms.
The enclosed cabin boat has seating capacity for eleven
Forward cabin contains six wicker
chairs and large observation cockpit
nished as Club Compartment suitable for cards, special
Writing Room or Lounge.
Dainty buffet lunches can be served.
Ample accommodations for personal baggage provided.
The open cockpit boat has a seating capacity for four
or ave people.
For information regarding time tables, rates and
reservations, phone Bryant 6147, or Bryant 4505.
Landing Piers, foot of 82nd Street, North River.
AEROMARINE AIRWAYS, Inc.

AIRTRAVEL
FOR BUSINESS OR PLEASURE

REG. U. S. PAT. OFF.
White Aerial Fleet
Now Operating Between
NEW YORK
BOSTON ALBANY
ATLANTIC CITY AND OTHER
NEW JERSEY COAST RESORTS
LONG ISLAND POINTS
FLORIDA AND CUBA
AERIAL : SIGHTSEEING • AROUND • NEW • YORK

Modern Method
of Travel,
MAKE YOUR RESERVATIONS TO-DAY AT THE
TYSON CO., Inc. Ticket Offices
OR TELEPHONE BRYANT 6147-4505

SIGHTSEEING
NEW YORK'S LATEST FAD-CHASERT SLANT
Ten or fifteen minutes of soaring through the clouds
will not only be a forever remembered
experience, but
it will add a sparkle to your conversation during the
years to come.
THE AiR is the ideal medium of travel—no charm equals
the fascination of flying. As soon as people fly, they realize
why all doubt has been removed from aviation. The hun-
dreds of thousands of people who use the air-liners be-
tween London and Paris have come to regard them as
safer, and certaily more comfortable, than the channel
steamers. The people who are flying daily between Havana
and Key West have welcomed air-liners as a veritable
Godsend after the disagreeable experience of a trip over
the choppy waters of the Gulf.
FAMILY PARTY OFF
FOR
FLIGHT
AEROMARINE
FLYING CRUISERS
"LIMOUSINES OF THE AIR"
SAFE, COMFORTABLE,
LUXURIOUS
Done minster away through
out beyond the dust and grime
and turmoil of crowded humanity?
This opportunity-the chance some people have been
seeking for years-is here and
waiting for
you.
The
actuality of a flight through sunny skies with far-flung
horizons is infinitely more enjoyable than any mere
mental picture you may have of it.
The dreams of long ago for the flight of man are realized
-out of the silvery
tissue of man's imaginative dreams
has come the reality in forms of broad white sturdy wings
that balance their palatial cabin of mahogany and silver
-and in its haven of comfort you can travel in a luxury
that would be the livid envy of ancient jewelled kings.
Đ
SEATING
ARRANGEMENT
"BE
SURE IT'S AN AEROMARINE"
SEE NEW YORK
FROM THE AIR
The latest, best and
quickest way to get a
comprehensive
of the Great Metrop-
olis and its historic
harbor, including the
Statue of Liberty, the
Battery, Wall Street,
Old Trinity, the Wool-
worth Building, and
hundreds of other in-
teresting sights of the
Island, is from the Air.
"BE
SURE
INTERIOR VIEW OF FORWARD CABIN
